respStmt.resp: Text based on the edition in
respStmt.name: Der Stricker. Fünfzehn kleine Verserzählungen mit einem Anhang: Der Weinschwelg. Edited by Hanns Fischer. Tübingen: Max Niemeyer, 1960.

respStmt.resp: Encoded in TEI P5 XML by
respStmt.name: Jordan Rosen-Kaplan

availability.p: The Global Medieval Sourcebook is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

notesStmt.p: This poem is a humorous ode to drinking alcohol which parodies medieval courtly poetry and the values of medieval court society (such as virtue, skill, loyalty and honor) by appropriating them to describe a less-than-respectable activity: drinking to excess. It was composed in the thirteenth century CE and is an example of the wave of satirical literature in German which rose to meet the previous half-century's idealising love songs and stories of romantic heroism. While Middle High German is often still thought of today as the language of the Minnesänger - highly-accomplished singers and composers whose best known subject was romantic love - poems like The Wino show that medieval audiences were not only interested in skilfully-crafted romance but indeed had a taste for biting satire.

sourceDesc.p: Der Stricker. Fünfzehn kleine Verserzählungen mit einem Anhang: Der Weinschwelg. Edited by Hanns Fischer. Tübingen: Max Niemeyer, 1960.

projectDesc.p: "The Wino" is published by The Global Medieval Sourcebook (GMS), a free, open access, and open source compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. GMS comprises computer-readable transcriptions or editions alongside new translations of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia. The GMS platform includes critical introductions as well as sources for further reading.

editorialDecl.p: Transcriptions and translations are encoded in XML conforming to TEI (P5) guidelines. The original-language text is contained within <lem> tags and translations within <rdg> tags.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern American English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Scribal errors and creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.rdg: Any drinking I have seen

app.lem: daz ist gar von kinden geschehen:
app.rdg: Is child’s play indeed:
I’ve seen a drunkard
Whose mastery I want to proclaim.
He considered cups inadequate,

app.lem: er wolde näpfe noch kopfe niht,
app.rdg: He wanted neither bowls nor pots,
But drank from large pitchers.
Of all men he is the
Forerunner of all drunkards.
Neither aurochs nor elks

app.lem: wart solher slünde nie niht getân.
app.rdg: Ever swallowed so much.

app.lem: ez muose alle zît vor im stân
app.rdg: There always had to be a
Large pitcher full of wine in front of him.

app.lem: er sprach: "wîn, ich erkenne dich wol!
app.rdg: He said, “Wine, I know you well!

app.lem: ich weiz wol, daz du guot bist.
app.rdg: I know that you are good.

app.lem: die wîle dîn in dem vazze iht ist,
app.rdg: As long as there is any of you left in this vessel,

app.lem: sô wil ich bûwen dise banc."
app.rdg:
I will sit here."
"Dise banc buwen" translates to to farm, to plow, to settle

app.lem: dô huob er ûf unde tranc:
app.rdg: Then he raised his glass and drank:
A drink of twenty swallows.
He said: "Now I want to proclaim

app.lem: waz tugent du hâst, vil lieber wîn.
app.rdg: your virtue, oh dear wine
How could you be more virtuous?

app.lem: du hâst schœne und grôze güete,
app.rdg: You’ve got beauty and great goodness,
You lend us high spirits,
You make the coward brave.
Whoever wants to bear your arms
Becomes wise and cunning,
He becomes fast and strong,
He fears no threat.
You make the sad happy,

app.lem: du gîst dem alten jungen muot,
app.rdg: You give young spirit to the old,

app.lem: du rîchest den armen âne guot,
app.rdg: You make the poor rich without any goods,
And you make people attractive.

app.lem: du bist ouch selbe schœne gar,
app.rdg: You are quite attractive yourself,
You are pure and clear."

app.lem: dô huob er ûf unde tranc:
app.rdg: Then he raised his glass and drank:

app.lem: Einen trunc, der für die andern gie.
app.rdg: A drink that was larger than the others before.
He said: "why and how
Should I avoid the wine?
I can handle it well,

app.lem: sît er allen mînen willen tuot.
app.rdg: Because it does whatever I want.

app.lem: er dunket mich bezzer denne guot;
app.rdg: I consider it better than good;
I never do without it.
I always want to praise it
Above jousting and dancing
Crown, circlet, and wreath,
Silk, samite, and scarlet,
Whatever adornment this world has,

app.lem: die næme ich niht für den wîn.
app.rdg: I would not take it over wine.

app.lem: in hât in dem herzen mîn
app.rdg: My love has given a home to it
In my heart,
Sealed it and enclosed it:
We can’t part from each other.
I would hate anyone forever

app.lem: der müese immer haben mînen haz.
app.rdg: Who wanted to make me dislike it.

app.lem: er kürzet mir die wîle baz
app.rdg: It entertains me better
Than storytelling, singing, or the sound of strings."

app.lem: dô huob er ûf unde tranc:
app.rdg: Then he raised his glass and drank:

app.lem: Einen trunc noch grœzer denne ê.
app.rdg: A drink even greater than before.
He said, "grass, flowers and clover
And the potency of all plants,

app.lem: die würze und aller steine kraft,
app.rdg: The herbs and the power of all stones,
The forest and all birds

app.lem: diu möhten dîn, vil lieber wîn,
app.rdg: They can’t delight anybody
Better than you, dear wine.
They cannot replace you

app.lem: mit allem dem, daz si kunnen.
app.rdg: With everything that they are able to do.
I will gladly allow you

app.lem: daz du mir kürzest die zît.
app.rdg:
To entertain
note about the concept of kurzwile me.

app.lem: swaz fröuden mir diu werlt gît,
app.rdg: Whatever joys the world gives me,

app.lem: diu kumt vil gar von dîner tugent;
app.rdg: They come from your virtues;
Your praise will prevail,
Your value will never fade."

app.lem: dô huob er ûf unde tranc:
app.rdg: Then he raised his glass and drank:
A drink so mighty

app.lem: und solde er eine halbe marc
app.rdg: That if he had been rewarded

app.lem: ze lône dâ mit verdienet hân,
app.rdg: Half a mark for this

app.lem: ern dörfte niht bezzers hân getân.
app.rdg: He couldn’t have done better.

app.lem: er sprach: "beidiu ich und der wîn
app.rdg: He said, "both me and the wine
Always have to be together.
I desire it,
And it has convinced me

app.lem: daz ich ie tet, swaz er mir gebôt.
app.rdg: That I always do what it bids me.

app.lem: der wîn ist guot für manige nôt.
app.rdg: The wine is good for many a problem.

app.lem: künde er niht wan fröude geben,
app.rdg: If it couldn’t do anything but give joy,

app.lem: diu werlt solde immer gein im streben.
app.rdg: The world should constantly strive for it.

app.lem: sîn fröude ist vor allen dingen.
app.rdg: Its joy is bigger than everything else.
I want to go after joy.

app.lem: sît mir der wîn fröude gît,
app.rdg: Since the wine gives me such a joy

app.lem: nu wil ich trinken unz an die zît,
app.rdg: I now want to drink to the moment

app.lem: daz er mir sô vil fröuden gebe,
app.rdg: that it gives me so much joy

app.lem: daz ich mit fröuden immer lebe.
app.rdg: so that I can live joyfully forever.
How can I ever become depraved?
I want to seek out joy.

app.lem: des habe mîn lîp immer danc!"
app.rdg:
My life
lîp can mean either life or body shall forever benefit from it!"

app.lem: dô huob er ûf unde tranc:
app.rdg: Then he raised his glass and drank:

app.lem: Daz man nie solhes niht vernam.
app.rdg: Such has never been heard.
He said: "Count Iram,
He had no wisdom at all (devoid)
because he rode in pursuit of a bison
He and his huntsman Nordian;

app.lem: si solden den wîn gejaget hân,
app.rdg: They should have hunted wine

app.lem: sô wæren si wîse, als ich bin.
app.rdg: Then they would have been as wise as I am.

app.lem: mir ist vil samfter denne in.
app.rdg: My life is more comfortable than his.
I can hunt and capture,
My pursuit does not wear me out.

app.lem: ich jage den vil lieben wîn;
app.rdg: I hunt the beloved wine

app.lem: des jäger wil ich immer sîn.
app.rdg: And forever want to be its huntsman.

app.lem: er hât mir ie sô wol getân.
app.rdg: It always did so well by me.

app.lem: swaz ich sîn her getrunken hân
app.rdg: All I have drunk of it so far,

app.lem: und swaz ich sîn naht unde tac
app.rdg: all that I may swill (guzzle) down
into my belly day and night,
That is but a beginning.
First, he raised his glass and drank:
Many enormous gulps.

app.lem: er sprach: "wîn, mir ist dîn tugent kunt.
app.rdg: He spoke: “Wine, your virtues are known to me
I well perceive your power
Your skill and your mastery.
You are master of the senses,

app.lem: du liebest mir für die minne,
app.rdg: You love me beyond love,
You firm up many deals,
You create a lot of competition,
You make work for many hands,
With much merriment and joy.

app.lem: diu werlt ist gar mit dir erhaben.
app.rdg: The world is elevated by you
You can revive the thirsty
And cure the sick.

app.lem: sît du mir êrste würde kunt,
app.rdg: Since I first discovered you

app.lem: sô bin ich dir gewesen bî:
app.rdg: I have always been with you
However many servants you have

app.lem: daz mich doch niemen von dir dranc."
app.rdg: None has come between the two of us."

app.lem: dô huob er ûf unde tranc:
app.rdg: Then he raised his glass and drank.
So that the gulps rang out loudly
And chased each other down the throat
Of strong swallows there was

app.lem: ein sturm, daz von den ünden
app.rdg: a storm, because of the waves
his throat grew too narrow
So that from the pressure
The currents started to swirl,
To roar and moan

app.lem: als ein windesprût ûf dem mere.
app.rdg: Like a tempest at sea.
The strength of many a gulp
Was thus tested by a fierce resistance.
He said: "I have never drunk

app.lem: daz ich noch niht getrunken hân.
app.rdg: with such mastery before.
My artistry is such
That I do not rush,
But I practice with leisure,

app.lem: durch daz ich ez lange trîben wil.
app.rdg: So that I can carry on for a long time.
No matter whether I live for a long or a short time
I never regret drinking.
If someone is quick on his feet
he could start me off well."

app.lem: dô huob er ûf unde tranc:
app.rdg: Then he raised his glass and drank
As if he would never want to stop.
He spoke: "Where could one find,
Were I to die, a man

app.lem: der trinke, als ich trinken kan?
app.rdg: who drinks as I can drink?
All drinkers gain honor through me.
I should be greatly thanked

app.lem: daz ich ir leben sô ziere.
app.rdg: for enriching their lives this way.
Four of the best drinkers

app.lem: die volgent mir wan ein tac.
app.rdg: Can’t keep up with me for even a day.

app.lem: ich kan wol trinken unde mac;
app.rdg: I can certainly drink and I will;
I have skills and stamina.
My heart is so virtuous

app.lem: daz ez an trinken nie gehanc."
app.rdg: That it was never unsteadied by drinking.

app.lem: dô huob er ûf unde tranc:
app.rdg: Then he lifted his glass and drank.

app.lem: Einen trunc, der die andern übersteic.
app.rdg: A drink that surpassed all others.

app.lem: dô stuont er ûf unde neic.
app.rdg: Then he stood up and bowed.
He spoke: “Wine, I bow to you.

app.lem: ich trûwe mit dir wol gesigen.
app.rdg: I am sure of winning with you.

app.lem: die wîle du bist mîn nâchgebûr,
app.rdg: As long as you are my companion

app.lem: mir enschadet der schîme noch der schûr;
app.rdg: I am harmed by neither bright weather nor storm,
I can’t nurse any worries,

app.lem: mir enschadet diu sunne noch der regen;
app.rdg: I am harmed by neither sun nor rain,
Joy raises my spirits.

app.lem: ich ensorge umbe êre noch umbe guot,
app.rdg: I worry about neither honor nor wealth
nor friends nor family.
I neither do battle nor do I quarrel

app.lem: und enruoche, wie blôz der walt stê.
app.rdg: Or concern myself with how bare the forest is.

app.lem: mir enschadet der wint noch der snê,
app.rdg: I am harmed by neither wind or snow,
Frost nor icicles."

app.lem: dô huob er ûf unde tranc:
app.rdg: Then he raised his glass and drank.

app.lem: Einen trunc, der grôze güsse truoc.
app.rdg: A torrential drink.

app.lem: er sprach: "diu houwe und der pfluoc
app.rdg: He spoke: "The how and the plough,
They would forever be abandoned

app.lem: wessen die gebûren, daz der wîn
app.rdg: If the farmers knew
that the wine wielded such great honor
And held such praise.
If they recognized his true virtue

app.lem: si vertriben ir alter und ir jugent
app.rdg: They would spend
both their old age and youth on wine.

app.lem: nu erkennent si in vil kleine.
app.rdg: Now they barely recognize it.

app.lem: daz hân ich ze einem heile.
app.rdg: That’s fortunate for me
because it’s cheaply available.

app.lem: daz machet mir mîn leben lanc."
app.rdg: That prolongs my life."

app.lem: dô huob er ûf unde tranc:
app.rdg: Then he raised his glass and drank
A drink of a hundred gulps.
He says: "it keeps me young
that I lengthen my drinks
and command my gulps
to swell and grow
and collide so rapidly

app.lem: daz die slege von den ünden
app.rdg: that the crashing waves
creates storms in my gullet.

app.lem: swer mir êrste gab den wîn,
app.rdg: He who first gave me wine

app.lem: des lop müeze immer sælic sîn.
app.rdg: should always be blessed with praise.
He taught me well.
May he always be honored for this,

app.lem: wan mir ie wol an ime gelanc."
app.rdg: because I always did well by him."

app.lem: dô huob er ûf unde tranc:
app.rdg: Then he raised his glass and drank

app.lem: Einen trunc langen und sô grôz,
app.rdg: a drink so long and deep,

app.lem: daz sîn alle die liute bedrôz,
app.rdg: that all the people
who saw and heard it became annoyed.
He said: "The time is approaching
when I can start drinking.
I’ve come to understood
that wine refreshes me
and cheers my heart.

app.lem: dâ wider bute ich mînen gruoz.
app.rdg: Again, I offer my greetings.

app.lem: wîn, ich valle dir ze fuoz.
app.rdg: Wine, I fall at your feet.

app.lem: ich enphienge dich gerne, kunde ich, baz.
app.rdg: I receive you well, and better if I could.

app.lem: ich enphâhe dich immer âne haz,
app.rdg: I always welcome you eagerly,

app.lem: du enphâhest mich, als tuon ich dich;
app.rdg: and you welcome me as I do you;
Our encounter is full of love;
May that be our beginning!"

app.lem: dô huob er ûf unde tranc:
app.rdg: He raised his glass and drank:
A drink that began to rush

app.lem: als daz wazzer ûf den flôdern
app.rdg: Like water on the wheels
Of every watermill there is.

app.lem: er sprach: "daz ist ein süeziu fluot,
app.rdg: He said: "That is a sweet flood

app.lem: diu wäschet mir von dem herzen
app.rdg: That washes both sorrow and pain
from my heart.

app.lem: er kan mich leides wol erjeten."
app.rdg: It can weed out my misery."

app.lem: dô begunde er springen unde treten
app.rdg: Then he began to jump and dance
Many a strange leap.
He said: "No one shall claim
that he is my equal.

app.lem: mîn herze ist sô vröuden rîche.
app.rdg: My heart is so rich with joy.

app.lem: der wîn, der mich dâ machet junc,
app.rdg: I want to dance for

app.lem: dem wil ich springen einen sprunc."
app.rdg: the wine that makes me young again.
For three hours he joyfully danced.

app.lem: dô huob er ûf unde tranc:
app.rdg: Then he lifted his glass and drank.

app.lem: Der trunc wart maniges trunkes wert.
app.rdg: The drink was worth many drinks

app.lem: er sprach: "ich bin der trinkens gert,
app.rdg: He spoke: "I desire to drink
I am a drinking man
Who can drink so much that
I can defeat all drinkers
And surpass them all.
I was never sated by drinking.

app.lem: ich kom noch nie an die stat,
app.rdg: I never reached a point
where I had had enough.

app.lem: wol der muoter, diu mich truoc!
app.rdg: Bless the mother who bore me!
May she, the queen, be blessed!
Blessed be the sweet love

app.lem: und diu wîle, dô si mich erranc!"
app.rdg: And the moment of my conception!

app.lem: dô huob er ûf unde tranc:
app.rdg: Then he raised his glass and drank
A heavy drink.
However large the vessel might have been

app.lem: si was zeinem trunke niht volgrôz,
app.rdg: It was not big enough for his drink,

app.lem: wan man ze einer nôt ingôz.
app.rdg: unless one continually refilled it.
He ordered it to be refilled quickly

app.lem: und lie daz in sich vliezen,
app.rdg: and let it pour down into him,

app.lem: daz dâ noch solhes niht geschach.
app.rdg: As has never happened before.

app.lem: dô saz er nider unde sprach:
app.rdg: Then he sat down and said:
"Wine is a true gem
I hear a sweet voice
sing in my head.
I enjoy hearing it chime.

app.lem: er ist rehte, daz ich in krœne:
app.rdg: It is right that I anoint it
It sings tones more sweetly
Than all kinds of sounds
And the singing of all birds.

app.lem: mir wart solhes nie niht bekant.
app.rdg: I never heard such a thing.

app.lem: er singet sô wol, daz Hôrant
app.rdg: It sings so well that Horant

app.lem: daz dritte teil nie sô wol gesanc."
app.rdg: Never sang a third as well."

app.lem: dô huob er ûf unde tranc:
app.rdg: He raised his glass and drank
So that the bench began to crack
He said: "I have to laugh about this

app.lem: des ist ze lachen harte guot;
app.rdg: And it’s well worth a laugh

app.lem: daz krachen fröuwet mir den muot.
app.rdg: The cracking raises my spirits.
It is done by virtue of the wine
I have completely drenched all my spirits
in den fröuden wol getrenket;
In joy.

app.lem: dar in hân ich mich gesenket.
app.rdg: I have plunged myself into it

app.lem: ich sanc ie sît der stunde,
app.rdg: And have been sinking since the hour
That I was first able to drink

app.lem: und mir der wîn sô wol geviel.
app.rdg: And wine first appealed to me.

app.lem: ich weiz wol, daz dehein kiel
app.rdg: I know well that no keel

app.lem: in daz mere sô tiefe nie gesanc."
app.rdg: Ever sank so deep into the sea

app.lem: dô huob er ûf unde tranc:
app.rdg: Then he raised his glass and drank
A massive drink.
He said: "I have been rejuvenated
In body and spirit.

app.lem: wol mich", sô sprach der guote,
app.rdg: Good for me," the good man said,

app.lem: "daz ich sô gar ein meister bin
app.rdg: "That I am such a masterful

app.lem: an trinken! seht, daz heize ich sin!
app.rdg: Drinker! I pronounce it to be so!

app.lem: ich weiz wol: dâ ze Parîs,
app.rdg: I know well: in Paris
In Padua, in Treviso
In Rome, and in Tuscany
You can’t find anyone
Whom I haven’t surpassed

app.lem: daz mir nie gein einer vesen
app.rdg: None of them can be compared
To me, not even a little bit.
Frankly, in no German lands
Can anyone come close to being
As steadfast a drinker
Both mornings and evenings.
I want to be wine’s companion

app.lem: wil ich hiute und immer wesen.
app.rdg: Today and always.

app.lem: mîn sêle muoz mit ime genesen.
app.rdg: My soul will always thrive with it.

app.lem: im ist mîn sêle immer holt,
app.rdg: My soul is always beholden to it

app.lem: swenne er schœne als ein golt
app.rdg: When it flows from the tap
As beautiful as gold.
It doesn’t bother me at all

app.lem: swaz man sîn in mich giuzet;
app.rdg: Which wine is poured into me.

app.lem: vil wol mîn lîp des geniuzet.
app.rdg: I enjoy it very much.
People talk of tournaments.
I can easily be the

app.lem: daz kan ich wol, des habe ich danc."
app.rdg: Best of four. I’m grateful for that."

app.lem: dô huob er ûf unde tranc:
app.rdg: Then he raised his glass and drank.

app.lem: Einen trunc, der vil grôz was.
app.rdg: A drink that was very large.
He spoke: "Whatever anyone read ever
About those who practiced love
And died of love

app.lem: die wâren mir niht gelîche wîs.
app.rdg: They were never equal to me.
How king Paris died
Because of Helen!

app.lem: des tumpheit sol man immer klagen.
app.rdg: His idiocy should ever be lamented

app.lem: er solde den wîn geminnet hân,
app.rdg: He should have courted wine,

app.lem: sô het im niemen niht getân.
app.rdg: Then no one would have done anything to him

app.lem: vrou Dîdô lac von minne tôt,
app.rdg: Lady Dido lay dead from love,
Graland was killed and cooked

app.lem: und gab in den frouwen ze ezzen,
app.rdg: And given to the women to eat

app.lem: want si sîn niht wolden vergezzen.
app.rdg: Because they didn’t want to forget him.
Piramus and Thisbe,

app.lem: den wart von minne sô wê
app.rdg: They suffered so much from love

app.lem: daz si sich rigen an ein swert.
app.rdg: That they threw themselves on a sword.

app.lem: mîn minne ist bezzers lônes wert,
app.rdg: My love is worthy of a better reward
Than all their love.
My love is joyous
I pave the way for love
I am doing better than Turaze

app.lem: der von minne in dem sê ertranc."
app.rdg: Who, because of love, drowned in the lake."

app.lem: dô huob er ûf unde tranc:
app.rdg: He raised his glass and drank.
A drink with great haste

app.lem: der werte unz and die wîle,
app.rdg: Which continued until his
Belt burst.

app.lem: er sprach: "daz bant ist niht ein bast,
app.rdg: He said: "The rope with
Which I am tied to the wine
at all hours is not a mere ribbon

app.lem: daz ist mîn sælde und mîn heil,
app.rdg: It is my blessing and my salvation

app.lem: und sint ouch driu vil starkiu seil:
app.rdg: And is comprised of three strong strands:

app.lem: daz eine ist des wînes güete,
app.rdg: The first is wine’s virtue
The second is my steadfast spirit
The third is my habit.

app.lem: er mac mir nimmer werden leit,
app.rdg: I’ll never get tired of it,
I shall always love it.
I can’t escape it.

app.lem: wie zebræche ich einen sô starken stranc?"
app.rdg: How could I tear apart such a strong rope?"

app.lem: dô huob er ûf unde tranc:
app.rdg: Then he raised his glass and drank

app.lem: Sô sêre, daz si alle jâhen,
app.rdg: He drank so much that all who saw him drink
agreed that

app.lem: swaz er getrunken het unz dar,
app.rdg: One should completely forget
What he had drunk until now.

app.lem: der trunc behielte gar den prîs.
app.rdg: This drink clearly won the prize.
He said, "The world is foolish,

app.lem: daz si niht ze wîne gât,
app.rdg: Because it doesn’t turn to wine,
If it suffers any sorrow

app.lem: und trünke dâ für allez leit,
app.rdg: And drank away all suffering
Fear and toil

app.lem: für alter unde für den tôt,
app.rdg: Old age and death

app.lem: für siechtuom und für alle nôt,
app.rdg: Illness and all perils.

app.lem: für schaden und für schanden slac,
app.rdg: All damage and shameful blows,

app.lem: und für swaz der werlt gewerren mac,
app.rdg: And whatever troubles the world

app.lem: für nebel und für bœsen stanc."
app.rdg: Fog and bad smells."

app.lem: dô huob er ûf unde tranc:
app.rdg: Then he raised his glass and drank

app.lem: Sô sêre, daz sich diu kanel bouc.
app.rdg: So much that the pitcher bent.

app.lem: er sprach: "swaz ie flôz ode flouc,
app.rdg: He said: "All things that swim or fly
Should rightfully pay respect to me.
People should all
Bow to my command.

app.lem: diu werlt ist gar mîn eigen.
app.rdg: I own the world.
I have so much power

app.lem: daz ich tuon, daz ich wil.
app.rdg: That I can do what I want.

app.lem: swaz ich wil, daz ist getân.
app.rdg: Whatever I want is as good as done.

app.lem: daz ich allen mînen willen hân,
app.rdg: Since I can do anything I want
I am called Peerless.
My virtues are so great

app.lem: wære der werlde sô vil mê,
app.rdg: That if the world were larger

app.lem: daz das merr und ieslich sê
app.rdg: So that the ocean and lakes

app.lem: als guot wære als daz beste lant,
app.rdg: Were as fruit-bearing as the best land,

app.lem: daz müese stên ze mîner hant
app.rdg: Then it would have to be under my control

app.lem: und müese mir dienen âne wanc."
app.rdg: And serve me without hesitation.

app.lem: dô huob er ûf unde tranc:
app.rdg: Then he raised his glass and drank
For so long and so deeply,
So much and even more,
So fast and so forcefully,
That his shirt split.
He said, "I have a good idea

app.lem: ich weiz wol, waz dar wider stât;
app.rdg: I know what the solution is;
I can easily equip myself.

app.lem: er zôch einen hitzhals an sich
app.rdg: He pulled on a leather doublet
(He ordered it to be tightly laced)
As well as a hard and tight
Breastplate of good iron.
He said, "the pressure of the
Wine will now not tear me apart.
I’ve encased myself in such a way
That it cannot split me open.
I shall benefit from,

app.lem: daz ich ze fröuden mînen lîp
app.rdg: Having constrained my body

app.lem: getwungen hân, daz man noch wîp
app.rdg: as no man or woman has ever done before,

app.lem: sînen lîp sô sêre nie getwanc."
app.rdg: for the sake joy.

app.lem: dô huob er ûf unde tranc.
app.rdg: Then he raised his glass and drank.
